#summary Wiki syntax to write crunchy tutorials

This page describe the wiki syntax which will be available to write tutorials.

= General wiki syntax =

For general elements, the wiki syntax will be the same as the [http://moinmo.in/ MoinMoin] one.
Read the [http://moinmo.in/HelpOnMoinWikiSyntax Syntax reference].

The MoinMoin syntax is used because MoinMoin is the major wiki engine in the python world.

= Management of python code =

The most important change in the wiki syntax is the addition of a new "parser syntax" for VLAM <pre> markup, like (without spaces between bracket) this:
{{{
{ { {#!crunchy vlam stuff
 Python code
} } }
}}}
where "vlam stuff" can be the same parameters than the one in the "title" attribute of <pre> markups in html.

= Other VLAM makup =

Some other VLAM makup like:
  * <a title="external_link" ...></a>
  * <span title="load local"> one or more spaces </span>
  * <span title="load remote"> optional url </span>
can be implemented through macros, like:
  * <<ExternalLink(url name)>>
  * <<LoadLocal>>
  * <<LoadRemote(optional url)>>
